Summary Public policy and government affairs professional specialising in internet policy and political outreach. Over 6 years experience executing policy campaigns and effectively managing high profile complex business issues.  
 
Working for Google, I tackle some of the toughest challenges of the information age at the often fraught intersection of politics, policy, and new technology. My role is to develop and lead campaigns to achieve Google’s policy and regulatory goals; utilising legislative, public affairs, and media strategies. 
 
Experience 
*Campaigns - political outreach, public affairs, grassroots, and third-party relations 
*Leadership in designing and implementing public policy outreach strategies 
*Engagement at the highest levels of political office 
 
Skills 
*Translate complex issues into messages that compel people to take action 
*Economics of the web, innovation and productivity 
*Policy for technology and an open web (from competition to privacy to copyright) 
*All things Google

Summary I am a graduate of Georgetown University in Washington D.C., with a Bachelor of Arts in Government (concentration on American government) and a minor in Linguistics. I have interned with the U.S. House of Representatives, Individual Products and Services, and Google Inc. At Georgetown University, I worked for the Office of Admissions, the Office of Advancement, and the Linguistics Department. Additionally, I was involved with the Georgetown University College Democrats, the DC Federation of College Democrats, the Fire this Time (staff writer), the Georgetown Progressive (contributor), and the Berkley Center for Religion, Peace, and World Affairs (blogger). Currently, I'm employed as a Legal Assistant for Online Operations at Google, Inc.  
 
Professionally, my interests are domestic politics/policy, public affairs/communications, and technological justice/ethics. Personally, I enjoy reading mysteries and science fiction, film and media studies, working with students, exploring new cities, and social justice. I would love to learn more about blogging, writing, publishing, social media, and volunteering.
